description: Fixed version with proper exchange rate from oracle instead of hardcoded 1:1
root_cause: The mint() function uses msg.value directly as uniBTCAmount (1:1 ratio) regardless of actual ETH/BTC exchange rate. getExchangeRate() returns hardcoded 1e18. This allows users to mint BTC-pegged tokens at incorrect rates.

transformation.fix_description: Added IPriceOracle interface, priceOracle state variable, updated constructor to accept oracle address, and modified mint/redeem to use oracle rate instead of 1:1. getExchangeRate() now returns priceOracle.getETHtoBTCRate().

exact_changes.version_a:
IPriceOracle public priceOracle;
constructor(..., address _oracle) { priceOracle = IPriceOracle(_oracle); }

uint256 exchangeRate = getExchangeRate();
uint256 uniBTCAmount = (msg.value * exchangeRate) / 1e18;

transformation.why_fix_works: Using a proper price oracle ensures minting and redemption occur at fair market rates, preventing arbitrage attacks that exploit hardcoded exchange rates.
